choices.A: Recommend project implementation be postponed until all scenarios have been tested.
choices.C: Help management complete remaining scenario testing before implementation.
choices.B: Perform remaining scenario testing in the production environment post implementation.
choices.D: Determine whether the tested scenarios covered the most significant project risks.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The CISA Review Manual (Chapter 3) emphasizes that auditors should prioritize risk assessment during pre-implementation reviews. If critical risks are adequately addressed in tested scenarios, residual risks from untested scenarios may be acceptable under time constraints.

questions.question_text: During a pre-implementation review, an IS auditor notes that some scenarios have not been tested. Management has indicated that the project is critical and cannot be postponed. Which of the following is the auditor's BEST course of action?

choices.B: Ensure audit logs track emergency changes.
choices.A: Request that the help desk make the changes.
choices.D: Update production source libraries to reflect changes.
choices.C: Use an emergency ID to move production programs into development.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Emergency change control procedures require maintaining audit logs to track all changes, even in urgent scenarios. This ensures accountability, traceability, and compliance with governance standards.
CISA Study Guide (Chapter 7: Information Systems Operations) emphasizes that "For every change, transaction logs should be maintained. A transaction log is used as an audit trail for further investigation". This applies to emergency changes as well, ensuring changes are documented for post-implementation review.

questions.question_text: Emergency change control procedures MUST include which of the following requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
CISA Study Guide (Chapter 6: Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery) emphasizes that the BIA is foundational to BCP development: "The BIA identifies strategic resources and provides value to their recovery and operation [...] Without this analysis, criticality analysis is impossible to evaluate in terms of likelihood or cost-effectiveness in mitigation strategies". "The BIA is one of several steps of critical, detailed analysis that must be carried out before the development of continuity or recovery plans"

questions.question_text: Which of the following is MOST important to consider when developing a business continuity plan (BCP)?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
When establishing new vendor integrations, ensuring authentication and authorization checks for data interchange requests is the most critical security control to prevent unauthorized access, data breaches, or tampering during transmission.
CISA Review Manual (Chapter 7: Information Systems Operations) states: "All data exchanges with external parties must enforce strict identity verification (authentication) and role-based access controls (authorization) to ensure only approved entities can initiate or receive data transfers". "Authentication mechanisms such as API keys, mutual TLS, or OAuth 2.0 ensure that the vendor is legitimate, while authorization checks validate their permissions for specific data types".

questions.question_text: When establishing new integrations with a vendor, which of the following is an IS auditor's BEST recommendation to management concerning data security?

choices.B: Management should ensure data being shared is aligned with the acceptable use policy.
choices.C: Batch processing should be utilized during business hours to minimize disruptions.
choices.A: Data interchange requests should require authentication and authorization checks.
choices.D: Transaction logs should be monitored for completeness and accuracy.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the BEST approach to minimize the risk of devices being unavailable following a required firmware upgrade?

choices.A: Deploy incrementally from a staging environment.
choices.D: Roll into a mass distribution deployment.
choices.C: Automatically deploy to all devices directly from the manufacturer.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Incremental deployment via a staging environment minimizes downtime risks by allowing organizations to test firmware updates on a subset of devices before full-scale rollout. This approach ensures compatibility, detects issues early, and limits the impact of potential failures. Key Source References: Search Result (Memfault OTA Updates): "Deploy staged rollouts. Choose to release updates incrementally to 10%, 50%, or any size of your device fleet to test updates before you deploy to all devices". "Control update rollout schedules [...] to limit the blast radius of issues".

A. Deploy incrementally from a staging environment.

Deploying incrementally allows you to test the upgrade on a small number of devices first, ensuring that any issues can be identified and resolved before rolling it out to the entire network. This method reduces the risk of widespread disruption and allows for a controlled and manageable upgrade process.
